name: Deadbug
how_to_perform:
1. Lie flat on your back on an exercise mat. Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, directly above your shoulders.

2. Bend your knees at a 90-degree angle, lifting your feet off the floor so that your thighs are perpendicular to the ground and your shins are parallel.

3. Brace your core by pulling your navel in towards your spine and ensure your lower back is in contact with the mat.

4. Begin the movement by extending your right arm straight back towards the floor while simultaneously extending your left leg down towards the mat.

5. Keep your back flat against the mat and control the movement as you lower your limbs.

6. Pause briefly when your arm and leg are hovering just above the ground, then return to the starting position.

7. Repeat on the opposite side, extending your left arm and right leg.

8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a steady and controlled pace throughout.
short_summary: The Deadbug is a core-strengthening exercise performed by lying on your back and extending opposite arms and legs while keeping your back flat on the mat.
alternative_names: Supine alternating arm and leg raises
